thread.title: SNP MP jeered for asking whether Government had ‘deportation process’ for EU nationals
thread.title_full: SNP MP jeered for asking whether Government had ‘deportation process’ for EU nationals

title: SNP MP jeered for asking whether Government had ‘deportation process’ for EU nationals
text:
SNP MP jeered for asking whether Government had ‘deportation process’ for EU nationals SNP MP jeered for asking whether Government had ‘deportation process’ for EU nationals A SNP MP was jeered today after she asked whether the Government had considered how to deport EU nationals after Brexit. PUBLISHED: 19:32, Mon, Mar 13, 2017 | UPDATED: 19:42, Mon, Mar 13, 2017 
Ochil and South Perthshire MP Tasmina Ahmed-Sheikh was heckled in the House of Commons as she grilled Brexit Secretary David Davis on the rights of EU citizens currently living in the UK. 
The Government have insisted they cannot offer a guarantee over the rights of EU nationals until a reciprocal agreement is reached on the fate of British expats living on the Continent, which German Chancellor Angela Merkel has so far blocked. Related articles MPs vote to scrap ALL House of Lords amendments to Article 50 Bill 
Attempting to put pressure on Mr Davis, Ms Ahmed-Sheikh asked: “If it's the case that the Government isn't going to protect the position of EU nationals - and it then becomes the case the position of EU nationals isn't protected - has the Secretary of State given consideration as to a deportation process then?” 
But Ms Ahmed-Sheikh’s question sparked derision within the House of Commons, with Mr Davis also delivering a withering response to her comments. 
The Brexit Secretary replied: “She knows me very well. I think it is frankly incredible that anyone would imagine that me, I, of all people would sign up to a deportation process. 
“The answer here is simple and I make the point again, I take as a moral responsibility the future guarantees of all four million citizens, European citizens and UK together.” PARLIAMENT.TV Tasmina Ahmed-Sheikh clashed with David Davis in the House of Commons LIVE images from the House of Commons Mon, March 13, 2017 MPs tonight voted to scrap both House of Lords' amendments to the Article 50 Bill. ALSO The House of Lords has voted down an attempt to reinsert the amendment on EU nationals by 274 votes to 135. PA 1 of 18 The result of a vote on the Brexit Bill in the House of Lords, London, after MPs overturned House of Lords amendments to a Bill authorising Theresa May to commence Brexit negotiations It is frankly incredible that anyone would imagine I would sign up to a deportation process David Davis 
The clash came as MPs this afternoon considered a House of Lords demand for the Government to guarantee the rights of EU nationals already living in Britain. 
Unelected peers had attached the condition to the Government’s Article 50 Bill, forcing the proposed legislation back to the House of Commons. 
Mr Davis urged MPs to scrap the House of Lords amendment and pass the Article 50 Bill - designed to hand the Prime Minister the legal power to trigger EU divorce talks - without any conditions attached. 
MPs later backed his call and oveturned the peers' amednment on EU nationals' rights by 335 votes to 287, a majority of 48. 
The Brexit Secretary had warned any amendments to the short 137-word Bill could hamper Theresa May’s EU exit negotiations. Related articles
